Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey-black in section, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394604) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394604)
